intro: Malanea cruzii, commonly known as the Brazilian starfruit, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with five petals and a star-shaped appearance. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. The fruit, which resembles a small star, is edible and has a sweet, tangy flavor.
